channel.title: Kotlin
channel.description:
So I started exploring Kotlin earlier today.
As you can read on their site, Kotlin is a statically typed programming language targeting the JVM and JavaScript. It's being developed by JetBrains who have also published products like IntelliJ and ReSharper.
I for one find it a rather nice language, fun to work with. Just wondering what some of you more experienced programmers think of it?
[url=http://kotlinlang.org/]Kotlin[/url] - [url=http://kotlinlang.org/docs/reference/]Learn[/url]

item.title: Kotlin
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

I like the syntax. I might give it a whirl.

Read full topic

item.title: Kotlin
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

It looks somewhat like Scala without many of Scala’s features.

Read full topic

item.title: Kotlin
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

It looks interesting but I don’t really see any point to using it over Java. It’s simply Java with a rewritten syntax, which seems cool, but it looks a lot more like a fun project than a useful one

Read full topic
